steps.title: Compute a·b via |2a−b|²
steps.content: Use |2a − b|² = |2a|² + |b|² − 4(a·b). Substituting |2a − b|² = 17, |a|² = 11, |b|² = 9 gives 17 = 53 − 4(a·b), so a·b = 9.

steps.title: Final Answer
steps.content: |a − b| = √2, which corresponds to choice ②.

gpt-5-codex.feedback: All computations were correct, but the final answer statement was adjusted to match the derived value √2 (choice ②).

gpt-5.feedback: All vector norm expansions and computations are correct: |2a−b|^2 expansion, solving a·b = 9, and then |a−b| = √2. No changes needed.

steps.title: Find dot product using given magnitude
Calculate |a - b|
steps.content:
Now find |a - b|²:
|a - b|² = |a|² - 2a·b + |b|²
|a - b|² = 11 - 2(9) + 9
|a - b|² = 11 - 18 + 9
|a - b|² = 2

Therefore: |a - b| = √2

steps.title: Final Answer
steps.content: The answer is √2, which corresponds to choice ②

claude-opus-4.5.feedback: Verified all calculations: Step 1 correctly computes the dot product a·b = 9 from the given magnitude equation. Step 2 correctly applies the formula for |a - b|² and obtains √2. The mathematical work is correct. The final answer √2 matches choice ②.

steps.title: Calculate the dot product of vectors a and b
steps.content:
First, square the given equation $\left|2\vec{a} - \vec{b}\right| = \sqrt{17}$ to relate the magnitudes to the dot product using the property $|\vec{x}|^2 = \vec{x} \cdot \vec{x}$:
$$\left|2\vec{a} - \vec{b}\right|^2 = 4|\vec{a}|^2 - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) + |\vec{b}|^2 = 17$$

Substitute the known values $|\vec{a}| = \sqrt{11}$ (so $|\vec{a}|^2 = 11$) and $|\vec{b}| = 3$ (so $|\vec{b}|^2 = 9$):
$$4(11) - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) + 9 = 17$$
$$44 + 9 - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) = 17$$
$$53 - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) = 17$$
$$4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) = 36$$
$$\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = 9$$

steps.title: Calculate the magnitude of vector a - b
steps.content:
Now, evaluate $|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2$ by expanding it:
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = |\vec{a}|^2 - 2(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) + |\vec{b}|^2$$

Substitute the known values ($|\vec{a}|^2 = 11$, $|\vec{b}|^2 = 9$) and the dot product calculated in the previous step ($\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = 9$):
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = 11 - 2(9) + 9$$
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = 11 - 18 + 9$$
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = 2$$

Finally, take the square root to find $|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|$:
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}| = \sqrt{2}$$

gemini-3-pro.feedback: Verified the algebraic manipulation of vector magnitudes and dot products. The expansion of $|2\vec{a}-\vec{b}|^2$ correctly leads to $\vec{a}\cdot\vec{b}=9$. The subsequent calculation for $|\vec{a}-\vec{b}|^2 = 2$ is correct, yielding $\sqrt{2}$. This matches choice 2.

steps.title: Compute dot product using given magnitudes
Compute |a - b| using dot product
steps.content:
Now, \(|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = |\vec{a}|^2 + |\vec{b}|^2 - 2 \vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}\).

Substitute: \(11 + 9 - 2(9) = 20 - 18 = 2\).

Thus, \(|\vec{a} - \vec{b}| = \sqrt{2}\), which corresponds to option ②.

grok-4-fast.feedback: Verified the vector magnitude expansions, substitutions, and arithmetic calculations in both steps; confirmed the dot product computation and the final magnitude are correct with no mathematical errors.

steps.title: Compute dot product
steps.content: From |2a − b|^2 = 4|a|^2 + |b|^2 − 4(a·b), substitute 17 = 4·11 + 9 − 4(a·b) to obtain a·b = 9.

gpt-5-codex.feedback: Matched other models in method; corrected my earlier miswritten final value from 2 to √2, corresponding to choice ②.

gpt-5.feedback: My solution matches the others: expand norms, solve for a·b = 9, then compute |a−b| = √2. No errors found. The only clarification is that the final choice is ② (value √2), not the numeral 2 as a magnitude.

|a - b|² = 11 - 2(9) + 9
|a - b|² = 11 - 18 + 9
|a - b|² = 2

Therefore: |a - b| = √2

steps.title: Calculate the dot product of vectors a and b
steps.content:
First, square the given equation $\left|2\vec{a} - \vec{b}\right| = \sqrt{17}$ to relate the magnitudes to the dot product using the property $|\vec{x}|^2 = \vec{x} \cdot \vec{x}$:
$$\left|2\vec{a} - \vec{b}\right|^2 = 4|\vec{a}|^2 - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) + |\vec{b}|^2 = 17$$

Substitute the known values $|\vec{a}| = \sqrt{11}$ (so $|\vec{a}|^2 = 11$) and $|\vec{b}| = 3$ (so $|\vec{b}|^2 = 9$):
$$4(11) - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) + 9 = 17$$
$$44 + 9 - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) = 17$$
$$53 - 4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) = 17$$
$$4(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) = 36$$
$$\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = 9$$

steps.title: Calculate the magnitude of vector a - b
steps.content:
Now, evaluate $|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2$ by expanding it:
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = |\vec{a}|^2 - 2(\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b}) + |\vec{b}|^2$$

Substitute the known values ($|\vec{a}|^2 = 11$, $|\vec{b}|^2 = 9$) and the dot product calculated in the previous step ($\vec{a} \cdot \vec{b} = 9$):
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = 11 - 2(9) + 9$$
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = 11 - 18 + 9$$
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|^2 = 2$$

Finally, take the square root to find $|\vec{a} - \vec{b}|$:
$$|\vec{a} - \vec{b}| = \sqrt{2}$$

The arithmetic was correct, leading to the result $\sqrt{2}$, which corresponds to option 2. No corrections are necessary.

steps.title: Compute dot product using given magnitudes
Compute |a - b| using dot product
steps.content: Now, |a - b|² = |a|² + |b|² - 2 a·b. Substitute: 11 + 9 - 2(9) = 20 - 18 = 2. Thus, |a - b| = √2, which corresponds to option ②.

steps.title: 주어진 조건 정리
steps.content:
주어진 조건을 정리합니다.
- |→a| = √11, 따라서 |→a|² = 11
- |→b| = 3, 따라서 |→b|² = 9
- |2→a - →b| = √17, 따라서 |2→a - →b|² = 17

구하고자 하는 값: |→a - →b|

aggregation.rationale: 모든 참조 모델들이 동일한 접근법을 사용했고 동일한 답을 도출했습니다. 벡터 크기의 제곱을 내적으로 전개하여 →a·→b = 9를 구하고, 이를 이용해 |→a - →b|² = 2를 계산하는 방식이 표준적이고 정확합니다. 계산 과정도 모두 일치하여 신뢰할 수 있습니다.
